Posts.Content: Nov 22, 2007 03:45PM Jude_Aussie wrote: Hey thanks Marin. You're right, i've done nothing but cruise the internet looking for information and getting more confused by the minute!! I wanna keep busy but just seem to be walking round the house in circles, things i gotta do but just can't get it together. I'm trying now to completely detach myself from all this till we have something for sure. Till then, i agree with you..it could just be something "yucky" (lol) that will clear up in no time. So good to know someone can say..i know EXACTLY how you feel. Hangin in there and will definitely keep you posted. Thanks for bein there. (Even if it is on the other side of the world!)
Posts.Title: waiting for biopsy results Jude_Aussie Barbie7

Posts.Content: Jude_Aussie wrote: went to doc's Monday with bad rash and weeping crusty nipple area. he suspects Paget's Disease..never heard of it! had biopsy yesterday (Wednesday). was told might get results after lunch Friday, if not.. have to wait till Monday. can't sleep..if i don't get results today don't know how i'm gonna get through till Monday. Shoulda mentioned i'm new here and live in Australia. Look forward to giving and receiving support and prayers. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: waiting for biopsy results Jude_Aussie Barbie7

Posts.Content: Nov 23, 2007 12:59AM Jude_Aussie wrote: Just wanted to let you know, i got the results of the biopsy this afternoon..doc says no cancer. Cried with relief, couldn't begin to tell you the emotions going through my mind. Felt like i'd been asleep since Monday and somebody has just woken me up. So amazing how differently i view life now-compared to before i went to sleep. A very big heartfelt thank you to this site-albeit for such a short time. I could tangibly feel the support whenever i logged on and it helped so much. For each and every one of you ladies i send my very best wishes and prayers. Would still like to visit this site and see how you are doing. Love and Hugs, Jude.
Posts.Title: waiting for biopsy results Jude_Aussie Barbie7

Posts.Content: Dec 2, 2007 03:33AM Jude_Aussie wrote: Hi Lori, I do understand your worry. My doctor was quite "suspicious" of Paget's Disease when i went to him about my nipple. It was very itchy, dry and scaly, and weeping. I was totally gobsmacked. I'd never heard of it before, and no history of bc in my family. I went on the internet and just scared the living daylights out of myself some more. I ended up on this site just to talk to someone till i got the results from my core biopsy. The ladies here are all so supportive, always with a kind word and hugs when needed. I sat up all hours of the night due to lack of sleep from worry reading the tons of support from one to another and it helped me immensely. As it turned out, Lori, my result was b9, but without the help of all these lovely ladies, my waiting would've been so much harder. Lori, I hope you too have good news. Thinking you you all the way from Oz.  Jude.
Posts.Title: Paget's Disease of the Breast 50gumbys Cathy1962

Posts.Content: Nov 22, 2007 09:33AM Jude_Aussie wrote: Hi momofbb, i have also been told by my doc he's quite sure i have Paget's Disease, have had my biopsy and waiting for results.. i also believe he could be wrong. I have two teenage boys but have decided not to tell them anything till we're absolutely sure. Good luck and best of wishes to you.
Posts.Title: Biopsy tomorrow Gale58 lvtwoqlt

Posts.Content: Nov 27, 2007 07:27AM Jude_Aussie wrote: Hi Traci from Australia! I know exactly where you're coming from Traci. My doc suspected Paget's Disease when i went to him about a terrible rash and discharge from my nipple last Monday (19th Nov). He ordered a biopsy to be done on Wednesday (21st Nov) and i was so scared. I'd never had a biopsy done before and didn't quite know what to expect. He did give me a local to numb the area and did a core biopsy. Quite uncomfortable, but only took a few minutes. Didn't realise how much it hurt till it was over, so wasn't so bad. The worst part was the waiting, was told maybe Friday (23rd Nov), if not then have to wait till Monday(26th). I couldn't wrap my head around what was happening so i posted my fears on this forum on Thursday (22nd i think!). The understanding and words of encouragement of the people here gave me an inner peace cos  i was not alone. As it turned out, i got my results on the Friday, and was told it was not Paget's Disease. Traci i hope you have a little ray of sunshine too. Best of luck.   Jude.
Posts.Title: Scared of Biopsy traci_t wvgirl
